items.title: New Labour Codes: Redefining manufacturing through financial & compliance shifts
NRB Bearings forms joint venture with Italy’s Unitec Group to strengthen industrial CRB portfolio
Nippon Steel sees US Steel weak performance as temporary
items.summary:
- **Nippon Steel** calls **US Steel**'s weak performance *temporary*, blaming tariffs, rate uncertainty, and operational issues, with a rebound next year as conditions recover.
- It will invest about **$11 billion** to lift profitability toward around **250 billion yen by 2028**, the plan to boost results despite near-term forecast cuts.
- The group completed the **$14.9 billion** acquisition and expects the full effect of **Big River 2**, while pursuing growth in the US, India, and Thailand.

items.title: Airbus confirms quality issue on A320 panels
items.author: AFP
items.summary:
- *Airbus* identified a *supplier quality issue* affecting a limited number of A320 metal panels, with the issue *contained* and newly produced panels conforming to requirements. 
- Shares initially dropped over 10% but later recovered as Airbus said it would *inspect all potentially impacted* aircraft and that fewer than 100 planes remained *immobilised*. 
- The A320, the world's best-selling airliner since 1988 with over 12,000 units sold by September, faces further attention after software-upgrade issues and the latest panel problem.

items.title: India's third ballistic submarine INS Aridaman to be commissioned soon: CNS Admiral Dinesh Tripathi
US manufacturing stuck in doldrums as tariff headwinds persist
JSW Defence, Shield AI launch $90M drone project in Hyderabad
items.summary:
- **JSW Defence** and *Shield AI* kicked off a **$90-million** project to build a VBAT UAS manufacturing facility in **Hyderabad** under a long-term licensing deal.
- The initiative will license technology, establish manufacturing and training to create a local supply chain and position India as a global VBAT production hub.
- The foundation stone was laid by *Parth Jindal* with Telangana officials, highlighting India’s push for self-reliance and *Indo-US defence collaboration*.

items.title: Steel panel meets companies on import substitution of high-value products
S&P upgrades Vedanta outlook to positive from stable
items.summary: *S&P Global Ratings* upgraded Vedanta Resources' outlook to **positive** from **stable**.\n- It affirmed Vedanta Resources' rating and noted improved cost structure from new facilities in the *aluminium* business aiding earnings and cash flow.\n- A potential upgrade hinges on continued debt reduction and the FFO-to-debt ratio moving toward **30%** over the next 12–18 months.

items.title: China issues first batch of rare earth licences
items.summary:
- *China has issued the first batch of rare earth export licences under a new regime centered on* **general licences** *to speed shipments to selected customers, reflecting commitments from the Trump-Xi summit.*
- *Licences have been issued to major producers such as JL Mag Rare Earth, Ningbo Yunsheng and Beijing Zhong Ke San Huan High-Tech,* with the system allowing* **one year** *of larger volumes and intended to supplement existing controls.*
- *Currently only large firms are eligible; eligibility could expand if the system proves effective, signaling a shift in Beijing's controls that Washington has described as the* **end of strict export controls**.*

items.title: TIL wins ₹200cr orders from CONCOR & Armed Forces
items.summary: - **TIL Limited** has secured contracts worth over ₹200 crore from **CONCOR** and the **Indian Armed Forces**, signaling growth in logistics and defence.\n- The **₹66.75 crore** CONCOR order covers 25 loaded reach stackers to be delivered within 330 days.\n- Defence orders totaling about **₹110 crore** for nearly 170 cranes under the **TIL Defence SBU** will be manufactured in eastern India and supported by its aftermarket network.

items.title: Websol & Linton to explore PV ingots and wafers in India
items.summary:
- **Websol Energy System** will collaborate with **Linton** to explore **PV ingot and wafers** manufacturing in India, including equipment acquisition and **training**.
- The plan aims to reduce imports and boost local tech via in-country production at **Falta SEZ** using **mono PERC technology**.
- **Linton** supplies **CZ furnaces** and process controls to support the project, aligning with Websol’s **1,200 MW** solar cell and **550 MW** module capacity.

items.title: Punjab govt delegation to visit Japan, South Korea for investor outreach
Refining, retail and mobility must converge for India to hit net-zero goals: Industry
TPG, MAVCO launch Vayona Energy after Siemens deal
items.summary:
- *Vayona Energy* is the new wind platform launched by TPG and MAVCO to scale wind deployment in India and South Asia. 
- The consortium named Vellayan Subbiah as Chairman and Prashant Jain as Executive Vice-Chairman, with *Siemens Energy* remaining a shareholder. 
- Based in Mumbai, *Vayona Energy* will be a leading wind turbine OEM with ~1,000 staff and a portfolio of ~12 GW of assets, a customer book over 1 GW and >8 GW O&M.

items.title: China’s pricing power is undercutting India’s export dreams
EV charging is India’s next power electronics play, says Exicom
Dalmia Cement gets tax relief as authorities drop ₹266 crore demand
items.summary:
- **DCBL** will face no tax outgo after the adjudicating authority withdrew demands totalling about ₹266 crore.
- The Sales Tax Officer in Tiruchirapalli dropped proceedings linked to two show-cause notices under the Central and Tamil Nadu GST Acts.
- The relief comprises ₹187.72 crore in tax and ₹78.59 crore in penalties, with formal orders received on Nov 28, 2025.

items.title: UBS upgrade lifts Asian Paints to top Nifty gainer
items.summary:
- **UBS upgrades** Asian Paints from Sell to Neutral, lifting its 12‑month target to ₹3,200 with a possible up‑side to ₹4,000.
- The stock rose ~1.5% to ₹2,911 in early trade, helping **Asian Paints** to be the top gainer on the **Nifty50**.
- UBS projects ~12% long‑term revenue CAGR and margin rebound; Q2 FY26 profit rose ~47% to ₹1,018 crore as volumes improve.

items.title: Data centre frenzy lifts US construction wages up to 30%
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- The data-centre boom is driving wage gains of **25–30%** for workers shifting into *AI infrastructure* projects.
- Notable earners include *DeMond Chambliss*, supervising 200 workers earning over $100k, and in Oregon *Marc Benner* earning about $225k while *Andrew Mason* in Northern Virginia makes over $200k.
- Beyond base pay, firms offer incentives like heated tents, free meals and daily bonuses as demand from **Amazon, Google and Microsoft** rises and a shortage of about 439,000 skilled workers persists.

items.title: Tata AutoComp completes IAC Sweden acquisition
items.summary:
- Tata AutoComp completed the acquisition of IAC Sweden, which will operate as **Artifex Systems** within the group.
- The deal expands Tata AutoComp's European footprint and deepens partnerships with **European OEMs** across passenger and commercial segments.
- Leaders say the integration unlocks growth opportunities and strengthens capabilities for a broader global footprint, with diplomatic support from India and Sweden.

items.title: Apollo Micro Systems receives DPIIT defence licence
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *DPIIT* approves a **15-year defence manufacturing licence** empowering Apollo Micro Systems to manufacture unmanned aircraft and radar systems.
- The licence covers unmanned helicopters, inertial navigation systems (*MEMS*, *FOG*, *RLG*) and complete radar systems with associated subsystems.
- MD Karunakar Reddy Baddam says the licence strengthens the company’s position in the *defence manufacturing ecosystem* and supports long‑term growth.

items.title: Great wall of Indian regulation bars China electronics cos’ path to funding
₹7,280 crore rare Earth magnet scheme: Industry hails REPM initiative; firms see reduced import dependence
With ₹7,000-crore war chest, Wipro Consumer eyes regional brands
items.author: Sagar Malviya, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- *Wipro Consumer Care & Lighting* has a war chest of about ₹6,000-7,000 crore (with the ability to raise more debt) to back an aggressive acquisition strategy.
- It is targeting *regional brands* in spices and personal care to broaden its portfolio and move into higher‑margin segments.
- The group has pursued several acquisitions, including **Glucovita**, Nirapara, Brahmins, Chandrika, and Yardley, leveraging local loyalty for faster integration.

items.title: Electronics and chip firms take a liking to new states entering fray
Need to expand footwear exports: President
items.summary:
- *President Droupadi Murmu* said India is a major footwear exporter and urged expanding the sector to boost exports, with support from the commerce ministry.
- She highlighted opportunities in sports and non-leather segments, noted a MoU with the University of Northampton, and stressed sustainable materials and a circular economy.
- *Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal* called FTAs a gateway for Indian footwear globally and urged graduates to pursue new markets, innovation, and high-quality goods.

items.title: ePlane Company targets 1st flight in 2 months; ambulance certification in 2027
ITPL opens greenfield bitumen derivatives plant near Chennai
items.summary:
- *ITPL*, a JV between IndianOil and TotalEnergies, inaugurated a greenfield Bitumen Derivatives Plant near Chennai.
- The facility will produce *PMB*, *CRMB*, *NRMB*, and bitumen emulsions to support highways and infrastructure across southern India.
- It aims to strengthen supply chains for *NHAI* and state highway programs with materials engineered for local climatic and traffic conditions.

items.title: Google's AI chip push spurs hope for Samsung, SK Hynix
Amazon staff warn AI push harming workforce and planet
items.summary:
- Over a thousand Amazon employees signed an open letter to CEO Andy Jassy warning that the rush into *AI* could harm the climate and workers' futures.
- The letter criticizes Amazon's climate plan and argues that the push to deploy *AI* data centers risks dirty energy and undermines *net-zero* commitments.
- The letter outlines three demands: *No AI with dirty energy*, *No AI without employee voices*, and *No AI for violence, surveillance, or mass deportation*.

items.title: India puts data sovereignty and chip self-reliance at core of expanding space push: Ex-ISRO Chief
Himadri HSCL's first liquid coal tar pitch export
items.summary:
- HSCL completed its first export of *liquid coal tar pitch* from the *New Mangalore Port*, shipping 3,600 tonnes to the Middle East.
- The shipment adds a second export route beside *Haldia*, boosting HSCL's reach in *international markets* across the Middle East and the Americas.
- HSCL plans further expansion with capacity planning, export corridor development, and enhanced port utilisation.

items.title: Sterling & Wilson wins ₹1,381 cr orders from Adani Green
items.summary:
- SWREL signed a five-year strategic partnership with **Adani Green Energy** and won the first purchase order for BOS on three solar projects at *Khavda Renewable Energy Park*, worth about ₹1,381 crore.
- With this win, SWREL has now achieved more than ₹6,450 crore of order inflows this financial year, and its pipeline remains robust.
- SWREL is currently executing about *6 GW* in the Khavda region, with *5 GW* scheduled for completion this financial year.

items.title: Shri Keshav Cements expands capacity to 1 MTPA
items.summary:
- Shri Keshav Cements & Infra has expanded capacity to reach **1 MTPA** of cement production. 
- Commercial operations at the expanded plant began on *Nov 29, 2025*, underscoring demand from infrastructure and housing. 
- The firm runs two Karnataka plants at 1,100 TPD with a **40 MW solar portfolio**, using 14 MW internally and exporting 26 MW to markets like North Karnataka, Coastal Karnataka, Goa and Maharashtra.

items.title: Pilibhit sugarcane dept adopts solar power mandate
items.summary:
- *Cane Commissioner Ministhy S* has mandated solar installations across Pilibhit's sugarcane department offices, cooperative societies, and sugar mills to boost *energy self-reliance* and cut emissions.
- The directive, issued after a meeting with *NEDA*, aims to reduce dependence on the *UP Power Corporation* and lower electricity costs while promoting environmental balance.
- Regional officials are to expedite installations at sugarcane research institutes, hospitals, degree colleges, and other department-linked facilities.

items.title: Manufacturing weakens in Europe, Asia on faltering demand and tariff uncertainties
Power, mining, manufacturing drag IIP growth to over one-year low of 0.4% in October
items.summary:
- The *IIP* growth slowed to *0.4%* in *October 2025*, dragged by weak *power*, *mining*, and *manufacturing* sectors.
- The NSO revised September 2025 growth to *4.6%*, while *manufacturing* output in October 2025 rose only *1.8%* YoY (vs *4.4%* a year ago).
- Power output fell *6.9%*, mining fell *1.8%*, and April–October FY26 IIP decelerated by *2.7%* from a year earlier.

items.title: NBC Bearings crackdown on counterfeits in Delhi and Bengaluru
items.summary:
- NBC Bearings' enforcement in Delhi and Bengaluru under its *anti-counterfeiting programme* led to seizures worth over ₹2 crore of counterfeit NBC-branded goods. 
- Raids in Delhi's Gali Rajan Kalan and Kashmere Gate and Bengaluru's JC Road recovered fake bearings, packaging, dies and a laser-marking machine used to forge codes. 
- NEI emphasizes *zero tolerance* toward counterfeit bearings, urges customers to buy from authorised dealers and use the NBC Connect app to verify authenticity while strengthening anti-counterfeiting measures.

items.title: Envision Energy bags 300 MW wind order from UPC Renewables
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- *Envision Energy India* has secured a **300 MW** order from *UPC Renewables India* for 60 wind turbine generators to be deployed in **Karnataka**, delivering ~**900 million units annually**.
- *The first 20 turbines (100 MW)* will be delivered early next year for a project tied to a **100 MW PPA** with *SJVN*, beginning in January 2027.
- *Alok Nigam* of UPC Renewables says the milestone will boost Karnataka's wind capacity toward **500+ MW** in three years, while Envision notes higher output than the **3.3 MW** model with fewer land parcels.

items.title: Industrial production slows to 0.4 per cent in October
items.summary: - India's *IIP* slowed to 0.4% in October, down from 4% in September.\n- The dip comes amid festivals and fewer working days, with *mining* and *electricity* output down about 1.8%.\n- Manufacturing rose 1.8%, and April-October shows *manufacturing* up 3.9% while *mining* fell 1.9%; the *eight core industries* (40% of IIP) remain a key driver.

items.title: MIC Electronics bags SCR passenger-info upgrade
items.summary: - The project will install an *Integrated Passenger Information System* (*IPIS*) at Annavaram and Yelamanchili, with *LED display boards*, clocks and GPS-based updates.\n- An *IP architecture* linked via optical fibre enables fast, central monitoring and secure, energy-efficient displays.\n- Completion is planned in 12 months with a 3-year warranty, adding to MIC Electronics’ footprint at over 200 stations.

items.title: Wockhardt soars after FDA NDA acceptance for new antibiotic
items.summary:
- The US FDA has accepted Wockhardt's NDA for Zaynich, a *first-in-class antibiotic* targeting *Gram-negative infections*, with a **Fast Track** designation.
- Wockhardt's shares rose as much as **12%**, trading near ₹1,386 after the news, marking a historic milestone for the Indian pharma industry.
- Zaynich uses a novel *β-lactam enhancer mechanism* and has drawn global attention for efficacy against difficult pathogens, including compassionate use in India and the US.

items.title: South Korea November exports beat forecasts, led by chips and autos
Su-57 jets, S-500 shield in focus: India likely to pitch mega arms deal with Russia during Putin visit
India PMI at nine-month low of 56.6 in November
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - The **PMI** fell to 56.6 in November, its slowest pace since February, signaling expansion but slower growth.\n- Delays in project starts, market uncertainty and competition restrained orders, while overseas demand growth cooled and input-cost inflation eased to a **nine-month low**.\n- Business sentiment weakened, with future output at its lowest in nearly three-and-a-half years amid tariff concerns and fading GST boosts.
